text: have you won today I'm making bandit a
specialty of central Vietnam one it
literally means little kick so they are
pretty small they are made from
glutinous rice flour dough with pork and
shrimps and mung bean fillings they
could come with a width outer banana
leaf the version without banana leaf is
called manic jung or naked little cake
let's begin to prepare the mung bean
paste wash half a cup of you two split
mung beans and then soak in water for
about an hour then drain well and cook
in a rice cooker would have a cup of
water until done then mash the cooked
mung beans into a paste together with a
teaspoon of sugar and half a teaspoon of
salt you can use the food processor or
any other machine tools do not grant
pork cut into small dices and then
season with some wings garlic and
shallots a little bit of pepper chicken
stock and a teaspoon or two of fish
sauce you also need hundred gram of
shrimps with a width outer skin I am
using very small shrooms I'm going to
keep the skin on just trim off the tip
the tails and the legs add some oil in a
pan and fry some in scallop until
fragrant then toss in the shrimps and
quickly stir fry for about 30 seconds on
high heat to bring out the orange color
of the shrimp then pass in the pork and
stir fry on medium heat until it's no
longer pink add a teaspoon of sugar and
stir for about two minutes then add a
tablespoon of his sauce and simmer on
low heat while stirring until the liquid
dries out turn off the heat add some
pepper and let cool to make the dough
you're gonna need 400 grams or 16 ounce
of glutinous rice flour is called book
nib in Vietnamese
only this kind of flour gives you their
constituency for the tumbling and you
can't really
place it with any other kind in a large
mixing bowl can buy the glutinous rice
flour we'll have a teaspoon of sorts
make a hole in the center slowly pouring
warm water at about 50 degrees Celsius
you're going to need about three no 70
to 400 ml of water depending on the
quality of the flour
don't pour all the water at a time
adding slowly because you can always add
more when it's filled to dry make sure
the water is neither too hot nor too
cold your spatula or spoon to mix it up
and then you can knead with your hands
until it's come together to form a dough
cover and let it rest for about 30
minutes to reduce the strong flowers now
grease the plate
in the palms of your hands with some
vegetable oil pinch a piece of dough and
flatten it out into a thin disc then add
some fillings into the center some
shrimps and pork and about half a
teaspoon of the mesh mung beans and then
pinch the edges together and form into a
nice ball then place them on the greased
plate to avoid sticking repeat until you
finish the dough and the feelings if you
want to wrap it in banana leaf grease a
piece of banana leaf with some vegetable
oil and then place the dough into it
folding the sides and the two ends
arrange them into a steamer and steam
for about 15 to 20 minutes for the ones
with a banana leaf you can either steam
or boil them occasionally wipe out the
water on the lid of the steamer so the
water will not drop into the dumplings
you can also buy the naked version just
bring the water to the boy dropping the
dumplings and then cook until they float
to the surface then take them out and
it's ready to serve for the banana leaf
version normally to make it more
eye-catching they will wrap it into
another piece of fresh banana leaf just
like that
to serve you can put some scallion oil
on top some pickled shredded carrots and
icons and dip into the light dip in fish
sauce mmm the outside is soft and
glutinous the inside is rich with that
mung beans the meat and shrimps really
add night textures and tastes I hope you
like it and don't forget to subscribe to
my channel for more delicious Vietnamese
food thank you for watching bye
